mapper.sql: id, doctor_id, user_id, user_name, user_mobile, description, upload_files, make_date, make_type, status, create_time
mapper.insert: insert into tb_doctor_order (id, doctor_id, user_id, user_name, user_mobile, description, upload_files, make_date, make_type) values (#{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{doctorId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userMobile,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{uploadFiles,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{makeDate,jdbcType=DATE}, #{makeType,jdbcType=TINYINT})
mapper.select:
SELECT o.id, o.doctor_id as doctorId, o.user_name as patientName, o.user_mobile as patientMobile, o.make_date as makeDate, o.make_type as makeType, o.description as patientDesc, o.create_time as createTime, o.pay as pay, o.code as code, o.status as status,
u.name_ as doctorName, d.profession_title as professionTitle, g.orgName, d.dept_name as deptName, d.yprice, d.price, d.skill_info as skillInfo, d.describe_ as description FROM tb_doctor_order o LEFT JOIN sys_user u on o.doctor_id = u.id LEFT JOIN sys_doctor d on d.user_id = u.id LEFT JOIN sys_org g on g.id = u.org_id WHERE o.user_id = #{userId}
mapper.insert:

mapper.update:
update tb_doctor_order
doctor_id = #{doctorId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},

where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update tb_doctor_order set doctor_id = #{doctorId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, user_name = #{userName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, user_mobile = #{userMobile,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, description = #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, upload_files = #{uploadFiles,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, make_date = #{makeDate,jdbcType=DATE}, make_type = #{makeType,jdbcType=TINYINT}, status = #{status,jdbcType=TINYINT}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
